SEARCH
Package cdx.opencdx.commons.cache

Class OpenCDXMemoryCache

java.lang.Object
org.springframework.cache.support.AbstractValueAdaptingCache
cdx.opencdx.commons.cache.OpenCDXMemoryCache
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cache
public class OpenCDXMemoryCache extends AbstractValueAdaptingCache
Simple Cache implementation based on the core JDK java.util.concurrent package.

Useful for testing or simple caching scenarios, typically in combination with SimpleCacheManager or dynamically through ConcurrentMapCacheManager.

Note: As ConcurrentMap only accepts null values for reference keys, this class will replace them with an internal null holder value. This should not affect any actual store value serializability.

As of Spring Framework 4.3, this class is also a AbstractValueAdaptingCache subclass.

Since:
3.1
See Also:
  • SimpleCacheManager
  • ConcurrentMapCacheManager

    • OpenCDXMemoryCache

      public OpenCDXMemoryCache(String name, ConcurrentMap<Object,OpenCDXMemoryCache.CacheValue> store, boolean allowNullValues, long timeToIdle, int maxEntries)
      Create a new ConcurrentMapCache with the specified name and the given internal ConcurrentMap to use.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the cache
      store - the ConcurrentMap to use as an internal store
      allowNullValues - whether to allow null values (adapting them to an internal null holder value)
      timeToIdle - the time to live in milliseconds
      maxEntries - the maximum number of entries in the cache

    • OpenCDXMemoryCache

      protected OpenCDXMemoryCache(String name, ConcurrentMap<Object,OpenCDXMemoryCache.CacheValue> store, boolean allowNullValues, long timeToIdle, @Nullable SerializationDelegate serialization, int maxEntries)
      Create a new ConcurrentMapCache with the specified name and the given internal ConcurrentMap to use. If the SerializationDelegate is specified, store-by-value is enabled
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the cache
      store - the ConcurrentMap to use as an internal store
      allowNullValues - whether to allow null values (adapting them to an internal null holder value)
      timeToIdle - the time to live in milliseconds
      serialization - the SerializationDelegate to use to serialize cache entry or null to store the reference
      maxEntries - the maximum number of entries in the cache
      Since:
      4.3

    • get

    • retrieve

      @Nullable public CompletableFuture<?> retrieve(Object key)
      Return the value to which this cache maps the specified key, generically specifying a type that return value will be cast to.

      Note: This variant of get does not allow for differentiating between a cached null value and no cache entry found at all. Use the standard AbstractValueAdaptingCache.get(Object) variant for that purpose instead.

      Parameters:
      key - the key whose associated value is to be returned
      Returns:
      the value to which this cache maps the specified key (which may be null itself), or also null if the cache contains no mapping for this key
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if a cache entry has been found but failed to match the specified type
      Since:
      4.0
      See Also:
      • AbstractValueAdaptingCache.get(Object)

    • retrieve

      public <T> CompletableFuture<T> retrieve(Object key, Supplier<CompletableFuture<T>> valueLoader)
      Retrieve the value to which this cache maps the specified key, obtaining that value from valueLoader if necessary.

      This method provides a simple substitute for the conventional "if cached, return; otherwise create, cache and return" pattern. 

      Object value = cache.get(key, () -> createValue(key));

      If possible, implementations should ensure that the loading operation is synchronized so that the specified valueLoader is only called once in case of concurrent access on the same key.

      If the valueLoader throws an exception, it is wrapped in a Cache.ValueRetrievalException

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value being loaded
      Parameters:
      key - the key whose associated value is to be returned
      valueLoader - the value loader to use to load the value if it is not in the cache
      Returns:
      the value to which this cache maps the specified key
      Throws:
      Cache.ValueRetrievalException - if the valueLoader throws an exception
      Since:
      4.3
      See Also:
      • get(Object, Callable)
